['Abound - To be present in great quantities; available widely or abundantly.', 'Copious - Being a large amount, which makes something readily obtainable.', 'Accessible - Easily approachable or reached; within convenient use or reach.', 'Plentiful - Existing in or yielding great supplies; found in great quantities.', 'Handy - Conveniently situated for accessibility or immediate need.', 'Prompt - Happening without delay; quickly available.', 'Ready-made - Prepared beforehand and easily usable or accessible.', 'At the ready - Being fully prepared and immediately available.', 'On hand - Present and readily available for use.', 'Immediate - Occurring or done at once; without delay.', 'Instant - Taking effect, occurring, or produced instantly.', 'Available - Capable of being used or obtained; ready for use.', 'On-demand - Provided immediately when required; readily accessible.', 'Efficacious - Successful in producing a desired or intended result quickly.', 'Ready to go - Prepared and able to be used without further preparation.', 'At your service - Immediately available for assistance or use.', 'Pronto - In readiness; immediately available.', 'Instantaneous - Occurring or done instantly; immediate in time.', 'Hands-on - Actively engaged and readily available to perform a task.', 'Quick fix - A fast solution, something that solves the problem promptly.', 'Starve - To suffer or die from lack of food; be extremely hungry.', 'Ravenous - Extremely hungry; voracious eating appetite.', 'Famished - Extremely hungry, starving for food.', 'Empty - Having nothing inside; when used in the context of hunger, it means no food is present to satisfy hunger.', "Vacant - An empty space or place that could be filled with food but isn't.", 'Hunger-stricken - Severely affected by lack of food.', 'Appetite - The natural desire to eat; when unsatisfied, it leads to feeling hungry.', 'Unfed - Not having been given or provided with food, resulting in hunger.', 'Gnawing - A continuous sense of discomfort due to lack of food intake, often used metaphorically but indicative of physical hunger as well.', 'Scanty - Small or insufficient amount; related to minimal food availability leading to hunger.', 'Indigestible - Literally cannot be digested, though not directly linked to being hungry, it implies an issue with obtaining nutrition from available resources.', 'Emaciated - Extremely thin or weak; starving can lead to such a state.', 'Foodless - Without food; synonymous with the experience of hunger when deprived of nourishment.', 'Malnourished - Lacking proper nutrition, which is directly related to being left hungry over an extended period.', 'Hollow-cheeked - Having cheeks that appear indented or sunken due to hunger.', 'Lean - Thin and less than average weight; may imply inadequate food intake leading to hunger.', 'Bare shelves - A metaphor for the absence of food items, hence contributing to a feeling of being left hungry.', 'Unsatisfied - Not fulfilled or appeased; can refer to an ongoing state of hunger if not fed adequately.', 'Underfed - Receiving less nourishment than needed, often leading to persistent hunger.']

['On tap - Refers to something that is immediately available for use (e.g., beverages).', 'Abundant - Implies a large amount of something easily accessible.', 'Easily obtainable - Means it can be acquired without difficulty.', 'Accessible - Something within easy reach or use.', 'Obtainable on demand - Available when requested.', 'At-hand - Immediately available and close by.', 'Handy - Conveniently located for quick access.', 'Quickly available - Can be accessed without delay.', 'Immediate - Refers to something happening or provided right away.', 'Within reach - Accessible and possible to achieve.', 'Available at short notice - Something can be accessed quickly upon request.', 'Up-to-the-minute - Referring to the latest or most current state, also suggesting immediate availability.', 'Promptly available - Suggests a quick response in terms of availability.', 'Quick-fetching - Refers to something that can be obtained rapidly.', 'Straightforward to obtain - Lacking complexity or difficulty in acquisition.', 'Directly obtainable - Can be acquired without any intervening steps.', 'Instantaneously accessible - Available right away, no waiting necessary.', 'Unfed - Not having been provided nourishment.', 'Undernourished - Inadequate intake of nutrition, leading to weakness and sickliness.', 'Starving - Extreme hunger, often due to lack of food availability.', 'Famished - Very hungry; can also refer to a prolonged state of needing food.', "Hungry stomach - A literal representation of the physical sensation of hunger in one's abdomen.", 'Inadequately fed - Not receiving enough or proper nutrition through diet.', 'Underfed - Receiving less than adequate nourishment, particularly over a period.', 'Deprived of food - Lacking access to food necessary for health and well-being.', 'Nutrient-deficient - Absence or inadequacy of essential dietary components.', 'Fasting (when unintended) - Not eating by choice, which can lead to hunger if sustained.', 'Empty belly - A colloquial term indicating a lack of food and feeling hungry.', "Goiter (indirectly related to left hungry) - Can be caused by iodine deficiency; while not directly about being 'left hungry,' it relates to inadequate dietary intake.", 'Vitamin deficiency - Lacking necessary vitamins, which can lead to hunger due to poor health and nutrition.', 'Picky eater (can lead to hunger if not addressed) - A person who is selective about foods they eat, possibly leading to inadequate nourishment.', 'Food insecurity - The state of being without reliable access to a sufficient quantity of affordable and nutritious food.', 'Underfed child - Refers specifically to children who have not received adequate nutrition.', "Unfulfilled appetite - Describes the feeling or condition where one's desire for food is not met, leading to hunger.", 'Empty pantry - A state of having no food available in storage; symbolizes a situation that could lead to hunger.', 'Lean and gaunt (due to lack of food) - Describes the physical condition resulting from insufficient nourishment or extended periods without adequate food intake.', 'Starvation-induced malnutrition - A severe form of undernourishment caused by an extreme lack of food over a long period, leading to weakness and ill health.']
